snippet: The administration's policy platform, outlined by the prime minister, Antonis Samaras, in a speech to Parliament, calls for selling off government assets and reducing state spending.
abstract: Greek Prime Min Antonis Samaras, in speech before Parliament, sets out his fragile three-party coalition government's policy platform; focuses on a bold program of selling government assets and reducing state spending, while also emphasizing the need to relieve an austerity-weary public.

byline.original: By NIKI KITSANTONIS and ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis reported from Athens and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The administration's policy platform, outlined by the prime minister, Antonis Samaras, in a speech to Parliament, calls for selling off government assets and reducing state spending.

headline.seo: Greek Leader Unveils Plan to Sell State Assets
headline.main: In Greece, a Bold Plan to Solve the Debt Crisis
headline.print_headline: Greek Leader Unveils Plan to Sell Government Assets and Reduce Spending
